Clearly this is the hammer of a very experienced blacksmith.
It is lighter than usual, with excellent balance, and you can feel the power of a possible blow in it.

A perfectly ordinary-looking pickaxe, but slightly lighter and with an aura of power around the jagged tip.
Once upon a time this pick belonged to a difficult gnome who knew his job and was always on the alert...

An old spear found near a dead gith outside the Alluring Cave in the Astral Plane.
The metal may have lost its strength, but astral rust and rot have given it paralyzing properties.

Armor of the zealous followers of the Absolute from the Moon Towers, imbued with true faith, which gives its owner mental stability, and the presence of the Absolute brand gives a bonus to trials and additional protection.

These gloves not only provide Dexterity of movement that is impossible with heavy mittens, but also severely punish the slightest mistake...
Being a surgeon is a huge responsibility!

If the melee attack is missed, the wielder will be stabbed with his own weapon for [1], and if he fails a Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throw</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">DC</LSTag> [2], he will <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLEEDING">bleed</LSTag> (on a critical miss without a saving throw).
Gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SURGEONS_DEXTERITY">Surgeon's Accuracy</LSTag> and a bonus [1] to <LSTag Tooltip="SleightOfHand">Sleight Of Hand</LSTag> rolls.

Gain an attack bonus [1] and <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throws</LSTag>.
The shield is dented and jagged, but it is imbued with the magic that Olam imbued it with in his desperate attempts to escape the Shadows.
The target is protected from beasts, undead and creatures woven from shadows. Such creatures' <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack rolls</LSTag> have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LSTag>.

Gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PROTECTION_FROM_EVIL">protection from evil</LSTag> and a melee attack bonus [1] against illuminated enemies, as well as <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack rolls</LSTag> against beasts, undead, and creatures woven from shadows.
Will of the Absolute extends the passive properties of the Absolute amulets to all characters with the Absolute brand within a radius of [1] from the wearer of the amulet.

This amulet of Selune is filled to the brim with the suffering and blood of pixies who died in the moon lanterns...
The result of experiments by the perverted, but very inquisitive mind of Balthazar.
A wielder with the Absolute brand has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws, but the Lunar Shield aura gives him a half reduction in all incoming spell damage.
Only an influential follower of Gargoth, also known as the Tenth Lord of the Nine or the Hidden Lord, could wear such a ring.

<LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> increases by [1], up to [2]. In addition, the wearer gains <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LSTag> when attempting to deceive those whose Charisma is lower than his, otherwise the deception check will be with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LSTag>.

If a humanoid inflicts melee damage on the owner, it must successfully pass a Charisma saving throw with a DC equal to the owner's Charisma, otherwise it will fall under the owner's influence for [1] turns.
The wielder's attacks against all charmed enemies have advantage.
The creature is under your influence and cannot attack you in any way. Taking damage removes the effect.
A weapon from Peartree's last batch, which he didn't manage to send. The infernal iron used in its manufacture gave it special properties.
A shield from Peartree's last batch, which he didn't manage to send. The infernal iron used in its manufacture gave it special properties.
Armor from Peartree's last batch, which he didn't manage to send. The infernal iron used in its manufacture gave it special properties.
Found in the Chult Jungles, this simple dagger fits perfectly in the hand, suggesting to its wielder that it can disembowel an enemy before they even know it.

Attacking with this weapon using <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> gains <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LSTag>, depending on who is more Dexterous.
When a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">critical hit</LSTag> is dealt, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="COLOR_SPRAY">«Color Sprays»</LSTag> will rain down from the enemy’s eyes.
A legendary axe that possesses incredible strength and increased striking range, but is too bulky and heavy for most mortals. Only a giant would be able to fight with it.

Attempt to cut an enemy in half, adding your proficiency bonus to damage rolls. This strike can cripple, and will certainly cause bleeding.
On a critical hit, the enemy must succeed on a constitution saving throw with a DC, equal to your Strength or take [1].
Flying creatures cannot be crippled, and undead and constructs cannot suffer from bleeding.
What, if not a war hammer, could be the favorite weapon of the Inventor of the Red Hammer! Forged with special skill, this hammer is a formidable weapon in skilled hands.

If you have <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">proficiency</LSTag> with warhammers and a <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> (if the hammer is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PACT_BLADE">bound</LSTag> by a warlock) score greater than [1], you can make an additional melee attack with that hammer.

Attacks on constructs deal an additional [1], ignoring <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistant</LSTag>, and attacks on <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_ATTACK_DEBUFF">shaken</LSTag> constructs have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LSTag>.

The Ring of Vellioth, one of the greatest vampires who ruled the Baldur's Gate clan before Kasador Zarr.
On the inside is engraved "What is the power...".

Those who have learned Vellioth's lessons master the full power of the Ring, and also receive an <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throws</LSTag> and bonus [1], but not more than [2], to <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>.

A fool who puts on the Ring of Vellioth without proper preparation receives only crumbs of the Ring's true power, as well as <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantages</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throws</LSTag> and a penalty of [1] to <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> и <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>.
The wearer of Vellioth's Ring increases Health by [1], Health and also regains [2] at the start of their turn if they are not in sunlight or taking radiant or holy water damage.
The wearer of Vellioth's Ring receives the weak spells Fly, Misty Escape, and Dominate Person.
The wearer of Vellioth's Ring receives additional action and powerful spells Fly, Misty Escape, and Dominate Person.

Transform into a tiny mist cloud. It can't fall, and fits through small openings. It is very hard to damage. Foes within [1] of the cloud may be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag> and take [2] at the start of the owner of Vellioth's Ring turn.

A graceful key, looks like it belongs to some safe. We need to find out what it opens.
On one side of the key, two symbols of the Zarr family are engraved...
The owner of the Absolute brand receives a bonuses [1] in <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throws</LSTag> and [2] to AC.
The weapon is covered in a strange astral rust. Targets struck by it can be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">paralyzed</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">poisoned</LSTag>.

You have successfully passed the <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throw</LSTag> against <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISON_ASTRAL_RUSTY_CONDITION">astral rust</LSTag> and can no longer be affected by it.

Attacks on <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">burning</LSTag> targets are dealt with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LSTag>, and this weapon also ignores <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistance</LSTag> to fire damage.
<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">Burning</LSTag> enemies have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack rolls</LSTag> against the wielder.

Not enough power for the ammunition used.
Your movement speed is reduced to a minimum, your attack and damage are reduced, you also have disadvantage on all checks and tests, and enemies have advantage on attack rolls against you.

Your weapon hits so hard that a target hit must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throw</LSTag> with a <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">DC</LSTag> or be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_ATTACK_DEBUFF">staggered</LSTag> for [1] turns if you are wielding the weapon one-handed, or [2] turns if you are wielding it with two hands.
You gain a bonus [1] on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throws</LSTag>.
